Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support because the official White House memo of the phone call does not mention President Trump discussing his commitment to help root out corruption or any of the other policy issues mentioned in the April 21 statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Trump's commitment to work together with President-elect Zelenskyy and the Ukrainian people to implement reforms that strengthen democracy, increase prosperity, and root out corruption was discussed in the April 21 call. However, the official White House memo of the call does not support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the official White House memo of the phone call does not mention President Trump discussing his commitment to help root out corruption or any of the other policy issues mentioned in the April 21 statement.
Understate: The claim understates the discrepancy between the April 21 statement and the call memo released by the White House. The call memo only mentions President Trump talking about the strength of the U.S. economy, sending someone to Zelensky's inauguration, and the Miss Universe Pageant, while putting off any discussion of the mentioned policy issues.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it relies on the April 21 statement to support President Trump's commitment to work together with President-elect Zelenskyy and the Ukrainian people to implement reforms, but the official White House memo of the phone call does not confirm this commitment.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists for the claim, suggesting that the April 21 statement may have been an inaccurate representation of the actual phone call, as indicated by the discrepancy between the statement and the call memo.
